Privacy Policy

Last Updated: February 22, 2025

1. Introduction

Welcome to eatingsolutionsforbreakfast.com ("we," "our," or "us"). This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your information when you visit our website. We comply with applicable global data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR - EU), California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA - USA), and Indiaâ€™s Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDP Act 2023).

2. Information We Collect

We do not collect personal data unless you voluntarily provide it (e.g., subscribing to a newsletter in the future). However, we may collect limited technical data through cookies or analytics tools.

2.1 Automatically Collected Data

  • Your IP address (temporarily stored for security and analytics purposes, anonymized after 30 days)
  • Browser type and version
  • Device type
  • Pages visited and time spent on them
  • Referral source (how you found our website)
  • Country/region of access (for analytics purposes)

3. How We Use Your Information

We use collected data to:

  • Improve website functionality and user experience
  • Monitor blog engagement and traffic patterns
  • Ensure security and prevent unauthorized access

We do not sell, rent, or share your data with third parties.

4. Cookies and Analytics

We use cookies and analytics tools to improve user experience and track visitor behavior. The types of cookies we use include:

  • Essential Cookies: Necessary for basic website functionality.
  • Performance & Analytics Cookies: Used for tracking visitor behavior and improving content (Google Analytics, if used).
  • Preference Cookies: Store user settings and preferences.

Google Analytics (If Used)

Our website may use Google Analytics to monitor traffic. You can opt-out of Google Analytics tracking by visiting: Google Analytics Opt-Out.

You can also disable cookies via your browser settings.

5. Third-Party Services

Our blog may contain links to third-party platforms (e.g., GitHub, LinkedIn). These sites have their own privacy policies, and we are not responsible for their practices.

6. Your Rights Under Global Privacy Laws

Depending on your location, you may have the following rights:

6.1 GDPR (For European Union Users)

Under GDPR, you have the right to:

  • Request access to your data
  • Request correction or deletion of your data
  • Object to processing or restrict data use
  • Request data portability
  • Withdraw consent at any time

6.2 CCPA (For California, USA Users)

Under CCPA, you have the right to:

  • Know what personal data is collected and how it is used
  • Request deletion of personal data
  • Opt-out of data selling (we do not sell data)
  • Non-discrimination for exercising your rights

6.3 DPDP Act (For Indian Users)

Under Indiaâ€™s DPDP Act, you have the right to:

  • Know how your personal data is processed
  • Request correction or deletion of your data
  • Withdraw consent for data collection

To exercise your rights, contact us at pranay@eatingsolutionsforbreakfast.com.

7. Data Retention

We retain user data as follows:

  • IP addresses are anonymized after 30 days.
  • Analytics and tracking data are stored for 6 months before being deleted.
  • If a newsletter is introduced, email addresses will be stored until the user unsubscribes or requests deletion.

8. Future Newsletter & Email Handling

If we introduce a newsletter in the future, we will:

  • Obtain explicit consent before collecting email addresses.
  • Store emails securely and not share them with third parties.
  • Provide an unsubscribe option in all emails.

9. Policy Updates Notification

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. When significant changes are made, we will:

  • Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this page.
  • Provide a notification on our website 30 days before changes take effect.
  • If email collection is introduced, we will notify subscribed users of policy changes.

10. Governing Law

This Privacy Policy shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of India, the European Union (GDPR), and California, USA (CCPA). If any disputes arise, they shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the courts of Hyderabad, India.

11. Contact Information

For questions about this Privacy Policy, contact us at:
